Student died after using two to three bottles of laughing gas a day

A student who may have been killed by long-term use of laughing gas was inhaling two to three “big bottles” of the substance each day, an inquest into her death has heard. Ellen Mercer, 24, was taken to hospital by the emergency services in the early hours of February 9 last year after she reported that she was unable to walk and would fall over when she tried, Berkshire coroner’s court heard.

A careless driver blocked traffic at a roundabout and drove through a red light during a ride-out in memory of two teenagers who died in an e-bike crash in Cardiff. The ride-out involved 80 vehicles travelling between Ely and Barry, and back.

Ryanair launches major expansion at Bristol Airport

Ryanair now flies to more than six times as many destinations from Bristol as Cardiff with more than 20 times as many flights every week. The airline today announced six new routes from the English airport this summer. The budget airline has added routes to Copenhagen, Fuerteventura, Marrakesh, Prague, Sofia and Tirana to its summer schedule from Bristol.
